revenue_performance.analysis: Revenue increased BECAUSE of strong performance in the Trademark Coca-Cola and sparkling flavors segments, THEN leading to higher net operating revenues.
revenue_performance.evidence_md:
|   |   | 2022 | 2021 | 2020 |
| Net Operating Revenues |   | 43,004 $ | 38,655 $ | 33,014 |
| Cost of goods sold |   | 18,000 | 15,357 | 13,433 |
| Gross Profit |   | 25,004 | 23,298 | 19,581 |
| Selling, general and administrative expenses |   | 12,880 | 12,144 | 9,731 |
| Other operating charges |   | 1,215 | 846 | 853 |
| Operating Income |   | 10,909 | 10,308 | 8,997 |
| Interest income |   | 449 | 276 | 370 |
| Interest expense |   | 882 | 1,597 | 1,437 |
| Equity income (loss) —— net |   | 1,472 | 1,438 | 978 |
| Other income (loss)—— net |   | (262) | 2,000 | 841 |
| IncomeBeforeIncomeTaxes |   | 11,686 | 12,425 | 9,749 |
| Income taxes |   | 2,115 | 2,621 | 1,981 |

cash_flow_stability.analysis: Cash flow from operations remained strong BECAUSE of consistent revenue growth and effective working capital management, THEN ensuring liquidity for future investments.

management_guidance_audit: The management has focused on expanding its product portfolio and enhancing operational efficiency. They have also emphasized sustainability and digital transformation as key areas for future growth.
key_risks_evidence: COVID-19 Impact | The pandemic may continue to affect operations and financial performance due to changes in consumer behavior and government restrictions. | COCACOLA_2021_10K.pdf | 24632fd3a7ed1f00
Product Safety and Quality | Concerns over ingredients and compliance with safety standards could impact brand reputation and sales. | COCACOLA_2021_10K.pdf | b708fce87cca2d7f
Sustainability Challenges | Issues related to packaging, water stewardship, and climate change could affect operations and stakeholder relations. | COCACOLA_2022_10K.pdf | 59cd8baca168a768
